fields.title: The God of Small Things
fields.summary: The story of fraternal twins Estha and Rahel and the traumatic childhood incident that forever alters their lives and family dynamics in Kerala.

fields.title: A Suitable Boy
fields.summary: Set in post-independence India, this epic follows four families as Mrs. Rupa Mehra searches for a suitable husband for her daughter Lata.

fields.title: The White Tiger
fields.summary: Balram Halwai, a chauffeur in Mumbai, writes letters describing his journey from village poverty to entrepreneurial success in modern India.

fields.title: The Inheritance of Loss
fields.summary: In Kalimpong, a retired judge's orphaned granddaughter Sai navigates her romance while their cook's son seeks opportunity in America.

fields.title: The Lowland
fields.summary: Two brothers' lives diverge dramatically when one becomes involved in the Naxalite movement while the other moves to America.

fields.title: The Palace of Illusions
fields.summary: The Mahabharata retold from the perspective of Draupadi, exploring her life, desires, and struggles in a patriarchal world.

fields.title: The Shadow Lines
fields.summary: A narrator pieces together family memories across Calcutta, London, and Dhaka, exploring how political borders create shadow lines in our minds.

fields.title: Interpreter of Maladies
fields.summary: Nine stories explore Indian-American experiences, examining marriage, love, and the immigrant condition with profound insight.

fields.title: The Guide
fields.summary: A corrupt tour guide transforms into an unwilling spiritual guide in this classic set in Narayan's fictional town of Malgudi.

fields.title: The Namesake
fields.summary: Gogol Ganguli struggles with his unusual name and cultural identity as he navigates life between his Bengali heritage and American upbringing.

fields.title: Sea of Poppies
fields.summary: On the eve of the Opium War, diverse characters aboard the ship Ibis find their fates intertwined in this epic of colonialism and trade.

fields.title: The Hungry Tide
fields.summary: In the Sundarbans, an American biologist, a Delhi businessman, and local villagers confront the volatile relationship between humans and nature.

fields.title: The Glass Palace
fields.summary: Spanning a century, this epic follows characters across Burma, India, and Malaysia through colonialism, war, and independence.

fields.title: August: An Indian Story
fields.summary: A young, westernized Indian civil servant finds himself in a bizarre small town, confronting the absurdities of bureaucracy and rural life.

fields.title: The Blue Umbrella
fields.summary: In a Himalayan village, a young girl's prized blue umbrella becomes an object of desire for the entire community.

fields.title: The Room on the Roof
fields.summary: An orphaned Anglo-Indian boy rebels against his guardian and finds friendship and freedom in the streets of Dehradun.

fields.title: The Vendor of Sweets
fields.summary: A traditional sweet vendor in Malgudi struggles to understand his modern, writer son who returns from America with unexpected ideas.

fields.title: Serious Men
fields.summary: A Dalit office assistant in a scientific institute creates an elaborate deception about his son being a genius to challenge the system.

fields.title: The Illicit Happiness of Other People
fields.summary: In 1990s Madras, a father investigates why his seemingly happy teenage son committed suicide three years earlier.

fields.title: The Folded Earth
fields.summary: A young widow moves to a Himalayan hill town and finds herself drawn into the lives of her landlord and a charismatic environmentalist.

fields.title: All the Lives We Never Lived
fields.summary: In 1930s India, a young boy's life is upended when his mother, inspired by dance and art, abandons the family for personal freedom.

fields.title: Em and the Big Hoom
fields.summary: A son and daughter in Bombay navigate their complex relationship with their brilliant but mentally ill mother and weary father.

fields.title: Cuckold
fields.summary: The crown prince of Mewar grapples with his wife's divine devotion to Lord Krishna and his own political and military ambitions.

fields.title: The Last Song of Dusk
fields.summary: In 1920s Bombay, a beautiful singer's perfect marriage is tested by tragedy in this lyrical tale of love, loss, and art.

fields.title: Family Matters
fields.summary: In Bombay, a retired professor's declining health forces his family to confront their relationships, secrets, and changing city.

fields.title: A Fine Balance
fields.summary: During India's Emergency period, four strangers from different backgrounds form an unlikely family while facing immense hardship.

fields.title: The Strange and Beautiful Sorrows of Ava Lavender
fields.summary: Born with bird wings, Ava Lavender explores her family's history of curious love and heartbreak in this magical multigenerational tale.

fields.title: The Tiger's Wife
fields.summary: A young doctor in a war-torn Balkan country unravels the mysterious stories her grandfather told about a deathless man and a tiger's wife.

fields.title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
fields.summary: A journalist and a hacker investigate the decades-old disappearance of a wealthy industrialist's niece, uncovering dark family secrets.

fields.title: Gone Girl
fields.summary: On their fifth anniversary, Nick's wife Amy disappears, and he becomes the prime suspect in a twisted game of marital deception.

fields.title: The Da Vinci Code
fields.summary: Harvard symbologist Robert Langdon uncovers a centuries-old conspiracy within the Catholic Church after a murder at the Louvre.

fields.title: And Then There Were None
fields.summary: Ten strangers are invited to an isolated island where they are killed off one by one, following a sinister nursery rhyme.

fields.title: The Silent Patient
fields.summary: A famous painter shoots her husband and then stops speaking; a criminal psychotherapist is determined to uncover her motive.

fields.title: The Thursday Murder Club
fields.summary: Four retirees in a peaceful retirement village meet weekly to investigate unsolved murders, but find themselves with a real case.

fields.title: In the Woods
fields.summary: Detective Rob Ryan investigates a child's murder in the same woods where he was found traumatized with no memory twenty years earlier.

fields.title: The Snowman
fields.summary: Inspector Harry Hole investigates a serial killer who builds snowmen outside the homes of his victims during Oslo's first snowfall.

fields.title: The Bourne Identity
fields.summary: A man is found floating in the Mediterranean Sea with no memory but extraordinary skills, discovering he is a deadly CIA operative.

fields.title: The Murder of Roger Ackroyd
fields.summary: Hercule Poirot comes out of retirement to investigate the murder of a wealthy widower in a small English village with shocking results.

fields.title: The Hound of the Baskervilles
fields.summary: Sherlock Holmes investigates the curse of a phantom hound that is terrorizing the Baskerville family on the gloomy Devonshire moors.

fields.title: The Girl on the Train
fields.summary: A divorced alcoholic becomes obsessed with a couple she sees daily from her train and inserts herself into their lives when the wife disappears.

fields.title: Big Little Lies
fields.summary: Three mothers in an affluent Australian town become embroiled in a murder investigation that reveals the dark secrets beneath their perfect lives.

fields.title: The No. 1 Ladies' Detective Agency
fields.summary: Precious Ramotswe sets up Botswana's first female-owned detective agency, solving cases with wisdom, humor, and understanding of human nature.

fields.title: One by One
fields.summary: Employees of a tech startup are trapped in a remote French chalet during a corporate retreat when a deadly avalanche strikes and people start dying.

fields.title: The Devotion of Suspect X
fields.summary: A brilliant mathematician devises the perfect alibi for his neighbor after she murders her abusive ex-husband, challenging a physics genius detective.

fields.title: The Woman in the Window
fields.summary: An agoraphobic child psychologist spies on her neighbors and witnesses a crime in the house across the street, but no one believes her.

fields.title: The Cuckoo's Calling
fields.summary: War veteran turned private investigator Cormoran Strike looks into the alleged suicide of a famous supermodel, uncovering a web of lies and fashion industry secrets.

fields.title: The Secret History
fields.summary: A group of eccentric classics students at an elite New England college commit a murder under the influence of their charismatic professor.

fields.title: Before I Go to Sleep
fields.summary: A woman with amnesia wakes up every day with no memory, keeping a secret journal to piece together her past and discover who she can trust.

fields.title: The Girl Who Played with Fire
fields.summary: Lisbeth Salander becomes the prime suspect in three murders while journalist Mikael Blomkvist races to prove her innocence and uncover a sex trafficking ring.

fields.title: The Talented Mr. Ripley
fields.summary: A young man with a talent for forgery and impersonation is sent to Italy to retrieve a wealthy man's son but becomes obsessed with his life.

fields.title: The Reversal
fields.summary: Defense attorney Mickey Haller is hired to prosecute a child murderer in a retrial, working with his ex-wife and half-brother Harry Bosch.

fields.title: Shutter Island
fields.summary: U.S. Marshals investigate the disappearance of a patient from a hospital for the criminally insane on a remote island in 1954.

fields.title: The Couple Next Door
fields.summary: A couple's baby is kidnapped while they are at a dinner party next door, and the investigation reveals that everyone is hiding something.

fields.title: The Dry
fields.summary: A federal agent returns to his drought-stricken hometown for a funeral and investigates a shocking crime that the community wants to keep buried.

fields.title: The Postman Always Rings Twice
fields.summary: A drifter begins an affair with a married woman and they plot to murder her older husband and take over his roadside diner.

fields.title: Dune
fields.summary: On the desert planet Arrakis, young Paul Atreides leads a rebellion against galactic oppressors while controlling the universe's most valuable resource: spice.

fields.title: The Lord of the Rings
fields.summary: A humble hobbit must destroy a powerful ring that could enable the dark lord Sauron to conquer Middle-earth, aided by a fellowship of diverse companions.

fields.title: Foundation
fields.summary: A psychohistorian predicts the fall of the Galactic Empire and establishes a foundation to preserve knowledge and shorten the coming dark age.
In a dystopian future, Winston Smith rebels against the oppressive Party and its omnipresent leader Big Brother in a world of constant surveillance.

fields.title: The Hobbit
fields.summary: A reluctant hobbit, Bilbo Baggins, embarks on an unexpected adventure with a group of dwarves to reclaim their mountain home from a dragon.

fields.title: Neuromancer
fields.summary: A washed-up computer hacker is hired for one last job that brings him face-to-face with a powerful artificial intelligence in a dystopian future.

fields.title: Ender's Game
fields.summary: Gifted child Ender Wiggin is trained in an orbital battle school to lead humanity's defense against an impending alien invasion.

fields.title: A Game of Thrones
fields.summary: Noble families vie for control of the Iron Throne in the Seven Kingdoms, while ancient evils awaken in the north and dragons are reborn.

fields.title: The Left Hand of Darkness
fields.summary: An envoy is sent to a planet where inhabitants can change gender, challenging his understanding of human nature while on a diplomatic mission.

fields.title: The Name of the Wind
fields.summary: The legendary wizard Kvothe recounts his life story, from childhood in a troupe of performers to his years at a university of magic.

fields.title: Snow Crash
fields.summary: A pizza delivery driver and hacker uncovers a ancient Sumerian linguistic virus that threatens both the virtual and real worlds.

fields.title: The Martian
fields.summary: An astronaut is stranded on Mars and must use his engineering skills and humor to survive until rescue becomes possible.

fields.title: Brave New World
fields.summary: In a futuristic world where humans are genetically engineered and conditioned for specific social roles, one man questions this perfect society.

fields.title: The Way of Kings
fields.summary: In a world shattered by storms and war, various characters including a slave, a soldier, and a scholar discover their destinies are intertwined.

fields.title: The Notebook
fields.summary: In 1940s South Carolina, wealthy Allie Hamilton falls for poor mill worker Noah Calhoun, a summer romance that spans decades and a lifetime.

fields.title: Me Before You
fields.summary: Quirky Louisa Clark becomes a caregiver for Will Traynor, a wealthy, cynical quadriplegic, and both their lives are transformed by their unexpected connection.

fields.title: The Bride Test
fields.summary: Khai Diep believes he cannot feel love, so his mother travels to Vietnam to find him a perfect wife, leading to an unexpected romance with Esme.

fields.title: Outlander
fields.summary: Former WWII nurse Claire Randall is transported from 1945 to 1743 Scotland, where she is forced to marry a chivalrous young warrior, Jamie Fraser.

fields.title: The Kiss Quotient
fields.summary: A brilliant econometrician with Autism hires a male escort to teach her about dating and relationships, leading to a surprising and heartfelt romance.

fields.title: It Ends With Us
fields.summary: Lily Bloom's relationship with neurosurgeon Ryle Kincaid is tested when her first love, Atlas, reappears, forcing her to confront difficult patterns.

fields.title: "Red, White & Royal Blue"
fields.summary: When the son of the U.S. President has a public confrontation with the Prince of Wales, a staged truce evolves into a secret, whirlwind romance.

fields.title: The Spanish Love Deception
fields.summary: Catalina MartÃ­n desperately needs a date to her sister's wedding in Spain and reluctantly turns to her annoying, handsome coworker Aaron Blackford.

fields.title: The Love Hypothesis
fields.summary: A PhD student fake-dates a famous young professor to convince her friend she's fine, but their staged romance soon develops into something very real.

fields.title: The Hunger Games
fields.summary: In a dystopian future, Katniss Everdeen volunteers to take her younger sister's place in the Hunger Games, a televised fight to the death between teenagers.

fields.title: The Fault in Our Stars
fields.summary: Two teenagers, Hazel and Augustus, who meet at a cancer support group, embark on a heartbreaking and transformative journey together.

fields.title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
fields.summary: A young boy discovers on his eleventh birthday that he is a wizard and is whisked away to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

fields.title: The Perks of Being a Wallflower
fields.summary: An introverted freshman named Charlie navigates the complexities of high school, friendship, and love through a series of letters to an anonymous stranger.

fields.title: Twilight
fields.summary: When Bella Swan moves to rainy Forks, Washington, she falls in love with Edward Cullen, a mysterious and alluring vampire, putting her life in danger.

fields.title: The Book Thief
fields.summary: Narrated by Death, this is the story of Liesel Meminger, a young girl in Nazi Germany who finds solace by stealing books and sharing them with others.

fields.title: Divergent
fields.summary: In a society divided into five factions, Tris Prior must choose where she belongs and uncovers a conflict that threatens to tear her world apart.

fields.title: To All the Boys I've Loved Before
fields.summary: Lara Jean's love life goes from imaginary to out of control when the secret love letters she wrote to all her past crushes are mysteriously mailed out.

fields.title: The Giver
fields.summary: Jonas is chosen to be the Receiver of Memory in his seemingly perfect, colorless community and discovers the dark secrets behind its existence.

fields.title: Six of Crows
fields.summary: Criminal prodigy Kaz Brekker is offered a chance at a deadly heist that could make him rich, but only if he can assemble a crew of six outcasts.

fields.title: The Nightingale
fields.summary: Two sisters in German-occupied France take vastly different paths to survive and fight against the Nazi regime during World War II.

fields.title: All the Light We Cannot See
fields.summary: The paths of a blind French girl and a German boy-soldier collide in occupied France as both try to survive the devastation of World War II.

fields.title: The Pillars of the Earth
fields.summary: A sweeping epic of ambition, anarchy, and absolute power set against the backdrop of the building of a cathedral in 12th-century England.

fields.title: The Kite Runner
fields.summary: Amir recounts his childhood in Afghanistan and his friendship with Hassan, the son of his father's servant, and a betrayal that haunts him for decades.

fields.title: War and Peace
fields.summary: A monumental work set during the Napoleonic era, following the lives of five aristocratic Russian families and their personal struggles.

fields.title: The Shadow of the Wind
fields.summary: In post-war Barcelona, a young boy discovers a mysterious book in a hidden library and embarks on a quest to find the truth about its author.

fields.title: The Henna Artist
fields.summary: Escaping an abusive marriage, Lakshmi becomes a renowned henna artist for the wealthy women of Jaipur, but her past threatens her new life.

fields.title: Homegoing
fields.summary: Two half-sisters in 18th-century Ghana are separated by fate; one marries a British slaver, the other is sold into slavery, tracing their descendants through centuries.

fields.title: The Last Queen
fields.summary: The epic story of Rani Jindan, the last queen of the Sikh Empire, who fought against the British Empire to protect her son and her kingdom.

fields.title: Randamoozham
fields.summary: The Mahabharata retold from the perspective of Bhima, the second Pandava, challenging traditional narratives and exploring his marginalized voice.

fields.title: Aadujeevitham
fields.summary: The harrowing true story of Najeeb, an Indian migrant worker forced into slavery as a goat herder in the deserts of Saudi Arabia.

fields.title: Naalukettu
fields.summary: A young man from a decaying matrilineal tharavad seeks revenge and identity while grappling with the decline of the traditional joint family system.

fields.title: Mayyazhippuzhayude Theerangalil
fields.summary: Set in the French colonial enclave of Mahe, it captures the lives of ordinary people amidst political change and the struggle for liberation.

fields.title: Aarachar
fields.summary: The story of a hangwoman and her family in Kolkata, exploring the moral and psychological burdens of executing death sentences.

fields.title: Ente Kadha
fields.summary: The candid and controversial autobiography of Kamala Das, detailing her journey as a woman, writer, and rebel in mid-20th century Kerala.

fields.title: Oru Desathinte Katha
fields.summary: An epic portrayal of life in a Kerala village, capturing its traditions, characters, and the winds of change over several decades.

fields.title: Pathummayude Aadu
fields.summary: A humorous and warm account of the author's large, eccentric family and the chaos caused by his sister Pathumma's beloved goat.

fields.title: Balyakalasakhi
fields.summary: A poignant love story between Majeed and Suhra, set in pre-Independence Kerala, torn apart by family feud and crushing poverty.

fields.title: Yakshi
fields.summary: A college professor falls in love with a woman he believes to be a Yakshi, a mythical vampire, in this psychological exploration of love and fear.

fields.title: The Palace of Illusions
fields.summary: The Mahabharata retold from the perspective of Draupadi, exploring her life, desires, and struggles in a patriarchal world.

fields.title: The Immortals of Meluha
fields.summary: A tribal leader named Shiva journeys to the land of Meluha and discovers he may be the fabled Neelkanth, the savior prophesied to defeat evil.

fields.title: The Ram Chandra Series: Ram - Scion of Ikshvaku
fields.summary: A human and gritty retelling of the Ramayana, portraying Ram not as a god but as a noble prince fighting for justice in a corrupt world.

fields.title: Jaya: An Illustrated Retelling of the Mahabharata
fields.summary: A simplified and illustrated version of the Mahabharata, collecting various regional folktales and philosophical interpretations of the great epic.

fields.title: The Krishna Key
fields.summary: A historian becomes the prime suspect in a murder and must decipher clues from Indian mythology to find the real killer and a terrifying secret.

fields.title: Sita: Warrior of Mithila
fields.summary: Book two of the Ram Chandra Series, reimagining Sita not as a damsel in distress but as a fierce warrior and brilliant strategist.

fields.title: Asura: Tale of the Vanquished
fields.summary: The story of the Ramayana told from the perspective of Ravana, portraying him as a capable and just leader fighting against Aryan domination.

fields.title: The Pregnant King
fields.summary: Inspired by a lesser-known tale from the Mahabharata, this novel explores themes of gender fluidity and non-conformity in a mythical world.

fields.title: Ajaya: Roll of the Dice
fields.summary: The Mahabharata from the point of view of the Kauravas, presenting Duryodhana as a tragic hero fighting for a more egalitarian society.

fields.title: Shakti: The Divine Feminine
fields.summary: A powerful retelling of the stories of the primary goddesses of Hindu mythology - Sati, Parvati, and Kali - and their manifestations as Shakti.

fields.title: Dubliners
fields.summary: Fifteen stories offering a vivid portrait of middle-class life in Dublin, capturing moments of moral and spiritual paralysis and sudden revelation.

fields.title: The Illustrated Man
fields.summary: A man's tattoos come to life at night, each one telling a different story about possible futures, exploring technology and humanity.

fields.title: The Yellow Wallpaper and Other Stories
fields.summary: A collection of pioneering feminist stories, including the famous title story about a woman's descent into madness under patriarchal control.

fields.title: What We Talk About When We Talk About Love
fields.summary: Seventeen minimalist stories about blue-collar Americans, exploring the complexities of love, communication, and human connection.

fields.title: The Women Who Forgot to Invent Facebook and Other Stories
fields.summary: Twelve sharp, witty stories about love, friendship, and life in modern India, exploring digital lives and contemporary relationships.

fields.title: Norse Mythology
fields.summary: Gaiman retells the classic Norse myths about the gods of Asgard, from creation to Ragnarok, with his characteristic wit and narrative flair.

fields.title: The Complete Short Stories of Anton Chekhov
fields.summary: A comprehensive collection of stories by the master of the short story form, capturing the full spectrum of Russian life and human nature.

fields.title: The Ministry of Utmost Happiness
fields.summary: While primarily a novel, this work reads like interconnected stories weaving together the lives of India's marginalized and dispossessed.

fields.title: The Discovery of India
fields.summary: Written in prison, this book explores India's rich history from ancient times to the British colonial period, reflecting on its philosophical and cultural heritage.

fields.title: India After Independence
fields.summary: A comprehensive account of India's political, social, and economic journey from 1947 to the end of the 20th century.

fields.title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
fields.summary: A groundbreaking narrative of humanity's creation and evolution that explores the forces that have shaped human societies and cultures.

fields.title: The Anarchy: The Relentless Rise of the East India Company
fields.summary: The story of how the East India Company looted the Indian subcontinent, transforming from a trading venture into a colonial power.

fields.title: Guns, Germs and Steel
fields.summary: Explores why human societies developed differently across continents, focusing on environmental factors rather than racial differences.

fields.title: The Last Mughal
fields.summary: The dramatic story of the fall of the Mughal Empire and the bloody rise of the British Raj in Delhi during the 1857 Uprising.

fields.title: The Silk Roads: A New History of the World
fields.summary: A retelling of world history with the Silk Road at its center, showing how the East has always been central to global development.

fields.title: India's Struggle for Independence
fields.summary: A detailed and analytical history of India's freedom struggle from the 1857 Revolt to Independence in 1947.

fields.title: The Rise and Fall of the Third Reich
fields.summary: A comprehensive history of Nazi Germany from its origins to its collapse, written by a journalist who witnessed the events firsthand.

fields.title: The Story of Civilization
fields.summary: An 11-volume comprehensive survey of Western history, focusing on philosophical and cultural trends from ancient times to the modern era.

fields.title: The Great Partition
fields.summary: A human history of the Partition of India, exploring the devastating human cost and lasting legacy of the division.

fields.title: A People's History of the United States
fields.summary: American history from the perspective of common people rather than political and economic elites, focusing on marginalized groups.

fields.title: Inglorious Empire: What the British Did to India
fields.summary: A searing critique of British colonialism in India, documenting the economic devastation and human suffering caused by British rule.

fields.title: The Histories
fields.summary: The founding work of history in Western literature, describing the background and events of the Greco-Persian Wars.

fields.title: The Emperor of All Maladies
fields.summary: A biography of cancer from its first documented appearances thousands of years ago through the epic battles to cure and control it.

fields.title: The Crusades
fields.summary: A comprehensive history of the Crusades, balancing perspectives from both Christian and Muslim sides of the conflict.

fields.title: The Wonder That Was India
fields.summary: A classic work on ancient Indian culture, civilization, and achievements before the Muslim invasions.

fields.title: Postwar: A History of Europe Since 1945
fields.summary: A comprehensive history of Europe from the end of World War II to the early 21st century, covering both Eastern and Western Europe.

fields.title: The Arabs: A History
fields.summary: A comprehensive history of the Arab world from the Ottoman conquests through colonialism to the modern era.

fields.title: The Last Lion: Winston Spencer Churchill
fields.summary: A definitive biography of Winston Churchill, covering his early life through his leadership during World War II.

fields.title: A Brief History of Time
fields.summary: Explores fundamental questions about the universe, its origin, structure, and eventual fate, from the Big Bang to black holes.

fields.title: The Selfish Gene
fields.summary: Introduces the gene-centered view of evolution, arguing that organisms are mere vehicles for the replication of selfish genes.

fields.title: The Gene: An Intimate History
fields.summary: A sweeping history of the gene and a personal account of how genetics may influence our futures, identities, and choices.

fields.title: The Innovators
fields.summary: The story of the people who created the computer and the Internet, exploring how their minds worked and what made them so inventive.

fields.title: The Code Book
fields.summary: A history of cryptography, from ancient Egyptian puzzles to modern quantum cryptography, explaining the science of secrecy.

fields.title: The Man Who Knew Infinity
fields.summary: The biography of Srinivasa Ramanujan, the mathematical genius who emerged from poverty in Madras to collaborate with G.H. Hardy at Cambridge.

fields.title: The Elegant Universe
fields.summary: Explains string theory and the quest for a unified 'theory of everything' that reconciles general relativity with quantum mechanics.

fields.title: The Sixth Extinction
fields.summary: Argues that the Earth is undergoing a modern, man-made sixth mass extinction, drawing on work from dozens of scientific disciplines.

fields.title: The Structure of Scientific Revolutions
fields.summary: Introduces the concept of paradigm shifts, arguing that scientific progress is not gradual but a series of intellectual revolutions.

fields.title: The Demon-Haunted World
fields.summary: A passionate defense of reason and science, providing readers with the tools to distinguish between science and pseudoscience.

fields.title: The Quantum Story
fields.summary: A history of quantum theory, from its birth at the dawn of the 20th century to its modern applications in technology.

fields.title: The Information
fields.summary: A history of information, from African drum languages to the invention of writing, the alphabet, and the modern information age.

fields.title: The Body
fields.summary: A guide to the human body, exploring its remarkable functions, its resilience, and the ways it can go wrong.

fields.title: The Hidden Life of Trees
fields.summary: Reveals the surprising social life of trees, describing how they communicate, support their sick, and maintain an ecosystem.

fields.title: The Order of Time
fields.summary: A poetic and profound exploration of the nature of time, arguing that our common-sense understanding of it is profoundly wrong.

fields.title: The Vital Question
fields.summary: Investigates the deep link between energy and genes, proposing a new theory for the origin of complex life on Earth.

fields.title: The AI Delusion
fields.summary: Argues that the real danger of AI is not super-intelligence, but our own inability to recognize its severe limitations and our own gullibility.

fields.title: Life 3.0
fields.summary: Explores the future of artificial intelligence and how we can ensure it benefits humanity, delving into consciousness and cosmic destiny.

fields.title: Atomic Habits
fields.summary: A practical guide to building good habits and breaking bad ones through tiny, incremental changes that yield remarkable results over time.

fields.title: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People
fields.summary: A holistic approach to personal and interpersonal effectiveness based on principles of character ethics and continuous improvement.

fields.title: The Power of Now
fields.summary: A guide to spiritual enlightenment that emphasizes the importance of living in the present moment to free oneself from suffering.

fields.title: Think and Grow Rich
fields.summary: A classic work that distills the secrets of success from hundreds of wealthy individuals, focusing on the power of personal belief.

fields.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a F*ck
fields.summary: A counterintuitive approach to living a good life, arguing that we should focus on a few important things and let go of the rest.

fields.title: How to Win Friends and Influence People
fields.summary: A timeless classic on the principles of effective communication, building relationships, and becoming a more influential person.

fields.title: Daring Greatly
fields.summary: Explores how the courage to be vulnerable can transform the way we live, love, parent, and lead in our personal and professional lives.

fields.title: The 5 AM Club
fields.summary: A story that reveals the morning routine used by many of the world's most successful people to boost productivity and achieve serenity.

fields.title: Mindset: The New Psychology of Success
fields.summary: Introduces the concept of 'fixed' vs. 'growth' mindsets and shows how success in almost every area of life can be influenced by how we think about our talents.

fields.title: The Four Agreements
fields.summary: A practical guide to personal freedom based on ancient Toltec wisdom, offering a powerful code of conduct for life.

fields.title: The Diary of a Young Girl
fields.summary: The poignant writings of a Jewish teenager while she and her family were in hiding for two years during the Nazi occupation of the Netherlands.

fields.title: Wings of Fire
fields.summary: The autobiography of India's 'Missile Man,' chronicling his journey from a small town to becoming the President of India.

fields.title: The Story of My Experiments with Truth
fields.summary: Mahatma Gandhi's autobiography, detailing his life, philosophy, and the development of his principles of truth and nonviolent resistance.

fields.title: Long Walk to Freedom
fields.summary: The epic autobiography of Nelson Mandela, chronicling his early life, education, 27 years in prison, and his pivotal role in reshaping South Africa.

fields.title: Steve Jobs
fields.summary: Based on interviews with Steve Jobs, this biography tells the story of the roller-coaster life and searingly intense personality of a creative entrepreneur.

fields.title: Educated
fields.summary: A memoir about a young woman who, kept out of school, leaves her survivalist family and goes on to earn a PhD from Cambridge University.

fields.title: Becoming
fields.summary: An intimate, powerful, and inspiring memoir by the former First Lady of the United States, detailing her journey from the South Side of Chicago to the White House.

fields.title: The Autobiography of Malcolm X
fields.summary: The story of human rights activist Malcolm X, from his childhood and criminal past to his ministry as a member of the Nation of Islam and his eventual assassination.

fields.title: My Life
fields.summary: President Bill Clinton's memoir is the strikingly candid portrait of a global leader who decided early in life to devote his intellectual and political gifts to serving the public.

fields.title: Unbroken
fields.summary: The incredible true story of Louis Zamperini, an Olympic runner who became an airman, surviving a plane crash, weeks adrift at sea, and years as a prisoner of war.

fields.title: The Glass Castle
fields.summary: A remarkable memoir of resilience and redemption, recounting the author's nomadic, poverty-stricken childhood at the hands of dysfunctional, idealistic parents.

fields.title: Into the Wild
fields.summary: The true story of Christopher McCandless, a young man who gave his savings to charity, abandoned his car and most of his possessions, and hitchhiked to Alaska to live in the wilderness.

fields.title: I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings
fields.summary: Maya Angelou's debut memoir recounts a youth filled with racism, trauma, and displacement, but also love, literature, and unshakable strength.

fields.title: Shantaram
fields.summary: A novel based on the author's life, about an escaped Australian convict who flees to Bombay and finds love, conflict, and unexpected humanity in the city's underworld.

fields.title: When Breath Becomes Air
fields.summary: A neurosurgeon's moving memoir, written as he faces a terminal cancer diagnosis, exploring what makes life worth living in the face of death.

fields.title: Born a Crime
fields.summary: The comedian and host of The Daily Show shares his remarkable story of growing up in South Africa under apartheid, born to a white Swiss father and a black Xhosa mother.

fields.title: The Last Lecture
fields.summary: A professor dying of pancreatic cancer delivers his final lecture, sharing his wisdom and life lessons about achieving childhood dreams and living a fulfilling life.

fields.title: Open
fields.summary: A candid and thrilling autobiography of the tennis legend, revealing his struggles with the sport, his personal life, and his remarkable comeback.

fields.title: Wild
fields.summary: A powerful, blazingly honest memoir about a woman's 1,100-mile solo hike along the Pacific Crest Trail, undertaken as a way to recover from personal catastrophe.

fields.title: My Gita
fields.summary: In his unique style, the author explains his personal understanding of the Bhagavad Gita and how its wisdom applies to modern life.

fields.title: The Lean Startup
fields.summary: Introduces a scientific approach to creating and managing successful startups by focusing on validated learning, rapid experimentation, and iterative product releases.

fields.title: Zero to One
fields.summary: Blake Masters and Peter Thiel argue that true progress comes from monopolies created by unique technology, going from 'zero to one,' rather than copying what works.

fields.title: The Intelligent Investor
fields.summary: A foundational book on value investing, teaching strategies for developing long-term strategies and protecting investments from substantial error.

fields.title: Thinking Fast and Slow
fields.summary: The Nobel winner details the two systems that drive the way we think: System 1 is fast and intuitive; System 2 is slower and more logical.

fields.title: Good to Great
fields.summary: A management study that identifies why some companies make the leap to superior results and others don't, focusing on disciplined people, thought, and action.

fields.title: The Psychology of Money
fields.summary: A collection of short stories exploring the strange ways people think about money, teaching that doing well with money has more to do with behavior than raw intelligence.

fields.title: Freakonomics
fields.summary: An economist and a journalist explore the hidden side of everything, applying economic theory to diverse subjects not usually covered by traditional economists.

fields.title: The Richest Man in Babylon
fields.summary: A timeless classic that offers financial advice through a series of parables set in ancient Babylon, providing common-sense rules for money management.

fields.title: Start with Why
fields.summary: Explores the concept that the world's most inspiring leaders and organizations all think, act, and communicate from the inside out, starting with a clear 'why'.

fields.title: Capital in the Twenty-First Century
fields.summary: An analysis of a unique collection of data from twenty countries, tracing the dynamics of wealth and income distribution since the 18th century.

fields.title: The Republic
fields.summary: A Socratic dialogue exploring the definition of justice, the order and character of the just city-state, and the just man through the voice of Socrates.

fields.title: Meditations
fields.summary: The personal writings of Roman Emperor Marcus Aurelius, offering a series of spiritual exercises and philosophical reflections on Stoic philosophy.

fields.title: Thus Spoke Zarathustra
fields.summary: A philosophical novel that introduces Nietzsche's concepts of the Ãœbermensch, the will to power, and the death of God through the prophet Zarathustra.

fields.title: The God Delusion
fields.summary: A polemic against religious faith, arguing that a supernatural creator almost certainly does not exist and that belief in a god qualifies as a delusion.

fields.title: Sophie's World
fields.summary: A novel that follows a teenage girl who receives a mysterious correspondence course in philosophy, tracing the history of Western philosophical thought.

fields.title: The Art of Happiness
fields.summary: Based on conversations with psychiatrist Howard Cutler, the Dalai XIV explores how to overcome anxiety, insecurity, and anger to find lasting happiness.

fields.title: The Prophet
fields.summary: A book of 26 poetic essays that discuss life and the human condition, covering topics such as love, marriage, work, reason, passion, and freedom.

fields.title: Being and Time
fields.summary: A seminal work in 20th-century philosophy that examines the question of Being through an analysis of human existence (Dasein) and its temporal nature.
